intro: Origanum latifolium, commonly known as broadleaf oregano, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its aromatic, slightly fuzzy leaves that are rich in essential oils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with upright stems and small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are widely used in culinary applications and traditional medicine due to their high content of phenolic compounds. Origanum latifolium thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy and versatile plant for gardens and landscapes.
